page.title: 03ECOLOGY OF TIDWORTH
page.content: The weather is temperate with clear air prone to heavy mists in Winter. The military limits the use of pesticides in the village and adjacent training areas which helps promote the abundance of birds,insects and wild animals,plus many trees,shrubs and wild flowers. Footpaths are well kept and signposted. Most common species of flora and fauna are well represented, some of which are{Trees}Chestnut,Scots Pine,Sycamore,Beech,Elder.{Plants}Wild Orchids,Cowslips,Harebells,Wild Rose, Knapweed,Scabious,Violets,Vetch,Sloes, Deadly Nightshade,Brambles,Cornflower. {Insects }A wide variety including Butterflies and Moths.{Reptiles}Grass Snakes,Adders,Slow Worms,Natterjack Toads.{Birds}Owls,Sparrowhawks,most of the Finch,Tit and Thrush families,Jays Pheasants,Partridges.{Animals}Numerous herbivorous and carnivorous mammals.
